name: Clin T
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with the greatest extension.

**Note 2:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category.

**Note 3:**  In-transit metastasis is coded in regional lymph nodes.

**Note 4:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category (T1, T2 or T3) based on the tumor size.

    Lesion(s) confined to dermis
    Confined to scrotum

    Subcutaneous tissue (through entire dermis)
    Adjacent connective tissue  EXCLUDING deep fascia

    Localized, NOS
rows:
Tumor invades deep extradermal structures, 
i.e., cartilage, skeletal muscle, fascia, or bone

Deep fascia, skeletal muscle

Adjacent organs/structures
    Male genital organs:
        Epididymis
        Penis
        Prostate
        Spermatic cord
        Testis

Underlying cartilage, bone

Further contiguous extension
    Other organs and structures in male pelvis:
        Bladder
        Rectum
        Urethra

Stated as T4

Unknown: extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension

Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest
dimension
Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension
